    (async, static) foreachAsync(array, callback) → {Promise.<void>}

    As the name says, forEach but then async

    Source:
    • utils.js, line 243
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    array Array | HTMLCollectionOf | HTMLCollection

    The array to loop over
    callback function

    The callback
    Returns:
    Type:
    Promise.<void>
    Example
    // Logs each item asynchronous with an 80 millisecond delay in-between
// You could use promises here too but it really isn't meant to be used with promises
await Utils.foreachAsync(["one", "two", "three"], async (item, index) => {
    await Utils.waitFor(80);
    console.log(`${index}: ${item}`);
});

    (async, static) forinAsync(obj, callback) → {Promise.<void>}

    Wrapper around for-in loop to make it async

    Source:
    • utils.js, line 261
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    obj Object
    callback function
    Returns:
    Type:
    Promise.<void>
    Example
    // Logs each item asynchronous with an 80 millisecond delay in-between
await Utils.forinAsync({"one": 1, "two": 2}, async (value, key) => {
    await Utils.waitFor(80);
    console.log(`${key}: ${value}`);
});

    (static) getUrlParameter(param) → {String|Boolean}

    Get the value from a URL parameter

    Source:
    • utils.js, line 89
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    param String

    The url parameter to get the value of
    Returns:
    Type:
    String | Boolean

    If defined will return the value else it returns false

    Example
    // Get the value behind companyID from the url
const companyID = Utils.getUrlParameter("companyID");

    (static) isNotNullOrUndef(value) → {Boolean}

    Check if the value is not null or undefined

    Source:
    • utils.js, line 77
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    value *
    Returns:
    Type:
    Boolean
    Example
    Utils.isNotNullOrUndef(null)       //=> False
Utils.isNotNullOrUndef(undefined)  //=> False
Utils.isNotNullOrUndef("")         //=> True
Utils.isNotNullOrUndef(0)          //=> True
Utils.isNotNullOrUndef({})         //=> True

Utils.isNullOrUndef({})         //=> False

    (async) getCookie(name) → {Promise.<(String|Null)>}

    Get a value from the cookies

    Source:
    • utils.js, line 279
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    name String

    Name of item to get
    Returns:
    Type:
    Promise.<(String|Null)>
    Example
    // Get value of SESSION
var session = await Utils.getCookie("SESSION");
if (!session) return console.log("No session found");
console.log(session);

    waitFor(ms) → {Promise.<any>}

    Wait x milliseconds

    Source:
    • utils.js, line 22
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    ms Number
    Returns:
    Type:
    Promise.<any>
    Example
    // Waits 1 second before logging "Hello"
const utils = new Utils();

// Using async/await
await utils.waitFor(1000);
console.log("Hello");

// Using promises
utils.waitFor(1000).then(() => console.log("Hello"));
